columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the AMI that was provided during image creation.

columns.name: image_id
columns.description: The ID of the AMI.

columns.name: state
columns.description: The current state of the AMI. If the state is available, the image is successfully registered and can be used to launch an instance.

columns.name: image_type
columns.description: The type of image.

columns.name: image_location
columns.description: The location of the AMI.

columns.name: creation_date
columns.description: The date and time when the image was created.

columns.name: architecture
columns.description: The architecture of the image.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The description of the AMI that was provided during image creation.

columns.name: ena_support
columns.description: Specifies whether enhanced networking with ENA is enabled.

columns.name: hypervisor
columns.description: The hypervisor type of the image.

columns.name: image_owner_alias
columns.description: The AWS account alias (for example, amazon, self) or the AWS account ID of the AMI owner.

columns.name: imds_support
columns.description: If v2.0, it indicates that IMDSv2 is specified in the AMI.

columns.name: kernel_id
columns.description: The kernel associated with the image, if any. Only applicable for machine images.

columns.name: owner_id
columns.description: The AWS account ID of the image owner.

columns.name: platform
columns.description: This value is set to windows for Windows AMIs; otherwise, it is blank.

columns.name: platform_details
columns.description: The platform details associated with the billing code of the AMI. For more information, see Obtaining Billing Information (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ami-billing-info.html) in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

columns.name: public
columns.description: Indicates whether the image has public launch permissions. The value is true if this image has public launch permissions or false if it has only implicit and explicit launch permissions.

columns.name: ramdisk_id
columns.description: The RAM disk associated with the image, if any. Only applicable for machine images.

columns.name: root_device_name
columns.description: The device name of the root device volume (for example, /dev/sda1).

columns.name: root_device_type
columns.description: The type of root device used by the AMI. The AMI can use an EBS volume or an instance store volume.

columns.name: sriov_net_support
columns.description: Specifies whether enhanced networking with the Intel 82599 Virtual Function interface is enabled.

columns.name: usage_operation
columns.description: The operation of the Amazon EC2 instance and the billing code that is associated with the AMI. For the list of UsageOperation codes, see Platform Details and [Usage Operation Billing Codes](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ami-billing-info.html#billing-info) in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

columns.name: virtualization_type
columns.description: The type of virtualization of the AMI.

columns.name: block_device_mappings
columns.description: Any block device mapping entries.

columns.name: product_codes
columns.description: Any product codes associated with the AMI.

columns.name: launch_permissions
columns.description: The users and groups that have the permissions for creating instances from the AMI.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags attached to the AMI.

columns.name: is_aws_backup_managed
columns.description: Is backup managed by AWS
